message.content:
cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper discusses the limitations of using accelerometers for human activity recognition and proposes the use of images instead. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper focuses on human-computer interaction and machine learning, which are relevant to the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories, respectively. The paper also discusses the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs), which are commonly used in multimedia (cs.MM) and neural networks (cs.NE) research. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV, followed by cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.MM, and cs.NE.
